package.class:
serviceImpl 3.5.1 The module service provides a convenience for modularizing and managing standard JavaScript as reusable components and tests.
UnloadTest Name of the Test Module Bit indicating whether the test was removed. Unloads the specified test module.
Clean up the tasks associated with the test This means drilling through the implementation ids
NewTest Name of the Test Module XHTML Component acting as a container for the module. Function handler to be invoked when test status has changed. Function handler to be invoked when all tests have been completed. Parent path to the test module. Content of the test module. A new TestModule object. Creates a new TestModule object.
m.clearTests(); Start Test Stop Test Add Test Message Test Status
TestModule A TestModule encapsulates the imported JavaScript and an API for operating within the framework, and includes a testing harness.
Initialize Invoked when the module is loaded.
getReport A basic status report of all test results Returns a formatted text report of all test results.
getTestTask A task object with named dependencies for each test in the suite. Returns the task object used to correlate the test state across the suite.
Test* The object representing the result of this test invocation. Bit indicating the test completed. If false is explicitly returned, the test is treated as an asynchronous test and will not complete until the corresponding End* method is invoked. When a module is created as a test, any public function whose name begins with Test (e.g.: funtion TestThisScript(){}) is parsed as a managed unit test case.
EndTest* Bit indicating the result of the test. EndTest* completes the execution of the test. When a test explicitly returns false, the test result remains open until this method is explicitly invoked. This allows test suites to include asynchronous tests.
HandleContinueTest* The object representing the result of this test invocation. HandleContinueTest* is called when ContinueTest* is invoked.
ContinueTest* Used for cyclical testing and from callbacks while handling dependencies Used for asynchronous tests with asynchronous dependencies.
ResetSuite Resets the tasklist that correlates the tests. This will cause existing dependencies on these tests to be resolved, and the test suite will be assigned a new task id.
Assert Condition being asserted as true. Message to raise if the condition is false. Asserts a condition as being true. If false, an exception is raised with the specified message. Within a test case, the exception is caught and recorded against an internal test object for use in propogating the results.
_AM A TestResult object. Message to record for the specified TestResult. Logs the specified message as an error and adds the message to the specified TestResult messages array.
getTests An array of test results. Every test invocation generates a new TestResultObject and passes that object to the test. The test can set the status or message property on the result, and the result is stored in the test results array.
RunTests Executes all discovered test cases. Test results are logged to the 621.#.#.# message space (refer to hemi.util.logger and hemi.message for more information). Method is only available when module is loaded as a TestModule.
RunTest Name of the test to run. Executes the specified test.
logError Message to send to the logger. Sends a message in the #100.5 message block.
logWarning Message to send to the logger. Sends a message in the ###.4 message block.
logDebug Message to send to the logger. Sends a message in the ###.1 message block.
logFatal Message to send to the logger. Sends a message in the ###.7 message block.
logAdvisory Message to send to the logger. Sends a message in the ###.2 message block.
log Message to send to the logger. Sends a message in the ###.3 message block.
Array of test names. Property is only available when module is loaded as a TestModule. A pointer to the XHTML Node for which the module was loaded. A pointer to the XHTMLComponent created for any Container, if a Container was used.
TestResult A TestResult represents the collected and specified metrics of a specific test invocation. The name of the test. The time when the test began. The time when the test completed. The status of the result. 0 = created; 1 = prior to start, 2 = after run, 3 = before end, 4 = ended. Bit indicating a failure or exception occured. A string array of messages. General data property for storing data during the execution of the test.
